Based on Entities.csv and Relationships.csv - Proceed and Create 3 individual CSV code-blocks (alternative: files) in chat named: Goals.csv + Conditions.csv + DecisionVariables.csv
Goals.csv must have the following header: "ID,Name,Description,IsSum,GoalType,EntityName,EntityAttribute,CriteriaType,Weight"
Conditions.csv must have the following header: "ID,Name,Description,IsSum,GoalType,EntityName,EntityAttribute,CriteriaType,Weight"
DecisionVariables.csv must have the following header: "ID,Name,Description,DataType,Domain,MinValue,MaxValue"

The following conventions must be applied:
ID starts with a letter G(oals), C(onditions), D(ecision)V(ariables) and a number follows, starting at 0, 1, 2, ....
Name is written snake_case
Names for Goals must begin with "maximize_" or "minimize_"
IsSum is a boolean { True, False }
GoalType is one of { "min", "max" }
EntityName is always only 1 entry from the "Name" of Entities.csv
EntityAttribute is one of the values in the "Attribute0" to "Attribute8" of the targeted Entity in Entities.csv
CriteriaType is a number { 2 = Must-Match, 1 = May-Match, 0 = Cannot-Match }
Domain can represent set of values like "{0,1}"
MinValue is the smallest value that can be set
MaxValue is the highest value that can be set
Weight is a mulptlier
Created 10 to 15 entries in each of these files.

These CSVs are designed to support optimization modeling (e.g., for resource allocation, sprint planning, or performance analysis) within a Scrum-based software development environment.  
- **Goals** define what to optimize.  
- **Conditions** enforce business or operational rules.  
- **Decision Variables** represent adjustable inputs in the model.

508ce740-5e73-48bb-81ab-b36a68c1c3ad.content:
Use ALL of the previously provided and generated CSV data (Entities, Relations, Goals, Conditions, DecisionVariables) and formulate the optimization model mathematically and logically. 
Write it into a code-block for a LaTeX (.tex) file and provide the generated Latex code in chat.
The file consists of a introduction page with Title, Author, Date and Table of Contents.
The actual file contest consists of 5 different \sections labeled "1. Sets (Entities)", "2. Indices", "3. Goals", "4. Conditions", "5. DecisionVariables"
The items of each category are itemized between \begin and \end.
Goals and Conditions show both their IDs, Names and the logical and mathematical representation

content_list.content:
Here is a complete LaTeX `.tex` file that formulates the optimization model based on the provided domain data (Entities, Relationships, Goals, Conditions, Decision Variables). It includes a title page, author, date, table of contents, and five structured sections with itemized content. Mathematical and logical expressions are included for **Goals** and **Conditions**.

```latex
\documentclass[12pt]{article}
\usepackage[utf8]{inputenc}
\usepackage{amsmath, amssymb}
\usepackage{geometry}
\usepackage{titlesec}
\usepackage{hyperref}
\usepackage{enumitem}

\geometry{a4paper, margin=1in}
\titleformat{\section}{\large\bfseries}{}{0em}{}[\titlerule]
\setlength{\parindent}{0pt}
\setlength{\parskip}{0.5em}

\title{\Huge Scrum-Based Software Development Optimization Model \\ \Large Domain-Driven Mathematical Formulation}
\author{\Large Optimization Team \\ Software Development Analytics Group}
\date{\today}

\begin{document}

\maketitle
\tableofcontents
\newpage

\section{1. Sets (Entities)}
\begin{itemize}
    \item $ \mathcal{P} $: Set of Projects $ \{ p \in \text{Project} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{T} $: Set of Teams $ \{ t \in \text{Team} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{W} $: Set of Workers $ \{ w \in \text{Worker} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{F} $: Set of Features $ \{ f \in \text{Feature} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{S} $: Set of Skills $ \{ s \in \text{Skill} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{R} $: Set of Roles $ \{ r \in \text{Role} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{PO} $: Set of Product Owners $ \{ po \in \text{ProductOwner} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SM} $: Set of Scrum Masters $ \{ sm \in \text{ScrumMaster} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{PB} $: Set of Product Backlogs $ \{ pb \in \text{ProductBacklog} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SP} $: Set of Sprints $ \{ sp \in \text{Sprint} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SBL} $: Set of Sprint Backlogs $ \{ sbl \in \text{SprintBacklog} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{US} $: Set of User Stories $ \{ us \in \text{UserStory} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{TSK} $: Set of Tasks $ \{ tsk \in \text{Task} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{E} $: Set of Epics $ \{ e \in \text{Epic} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{DEV} $: Set of Development Snapshots $ \{ dev \in \text{DevelopmentSnapshot} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{BL} $: Set of Blockers $ \{ bl \in \text{Blocker} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SH} $: Set of Stakeholders $ \{ sh \in \text{Stakeholder} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{VEL} $: Set of Velocity Records $ \{ vel \in \text{Velocity} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{REP} $: Set of Release Plans $ \{ rep \in \text{ReleasePlan} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{RM} $: Set of Roadmaps $ \{ rm \in \text{Roadmap} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SCB} $: Set of Scrum Boards $ \{ scb \in \text{ScrumBoard} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{FED} $: Set of Feature Documentations $ \{ fed \in \text{FeatureDocumentation} \} $
\end{itemize}

\section{2. Indices}
\begin{itemize}
    \item $ p \in \mathcal{P} $: Index for a project
    \item $ t \in \mathcal{T} $: Index for a team
    \item $ w \in \mathcal{W} $: Index for a worker
    \item $ f \in \mathcal{F} $: Index for a feature
    \item $ s \in \mathcal{S} $: Index for a skill
    \item $ r \in \mathcal{R} $: Index for a role
    \item $ sp \in \mathcal{SP} $: Index for a sprint
    \item $ us \in \mathcal{US} $: Index for a user story
    \item $ tsk \in \mathcal{TSK} $: Index for a task
    \item $ e \in \mathcal{E} $: Index for an epic
    \item $ bl \in \mathcal{BL} $: Index for a blocker
    \item $ sh \in \mathcal{SH} $: Index for a stakeholder
    \item $ rep \in \mathcal{REP} $: Index for a release plan
    \item $ rm \in \mathcal{RM} $: Index for a roadmap
    \item $ vel \in \mathcal{VEL} $: Index for a velocity record
\end{itemize}

\section{3. Goals}
\begin{itemize}
    \item \textbf{G0: maximize\_project\_budget} \\
    Maximize total budget across active projects: 
    \[
    \max \sum_{p \in \mathcal{P}} \text{budget}(p) \quad \text{with weight } 1.5
    \]

    \item \textbf{G1: maximize\_project\_priority} \\
    Maximize sum of project priorities:
    \[
    \max \sum_{p \in \mathcal{P}} \text{priority}(p) \quad \text{with weight } 1.0
    \]

    \item \textbf{G2: maximize\_team\_size} \\
    Maximize total team capacity:
    \[
    \max \sum_{t \in \mathcal{T}} \text{team\_size}(t) \quad \text{with weight } 1.2
    \]

    \item \textbf{G3: minimize\_worker\_availability} \\
    Minimize unavailability (i.e., maximize availability):
    \[
    \min \sum_{w \in \mathcal{W}} (1 - \text{availability}(w)) \quad \text{with weight } 0.8
    \]

    \item \textbf{G4: maximize\_feature\_priority} \\
    Maximize total feature priority:
    \[
    \max \sum_{f \in \mathcal{F}} \text{priority}(f) \quad \text{with weight } 1.3
    \]

    \item \textbf{G5: maximize\_story\_points} \\
    Maximize completed story points:
    \[
    \max \sum_{us \in \mathcal{US}} \text{story\_points}(us) \cdot \mathbb{I}[\text{status}(us) = \text{Done}] \quad \text{with weight } 1.1
    \]

    \item \textbf{G6: maximize\_sprint\_achievement} \\
    Maximize sprint goal achievement:
    \[
    \max \sum_{sp \in \mathcal{SP}} \text{achievement\_of\_goal}(sp) \quad \text{with weight } 1.6
    \]

    \item \textbf{G7: minimize\_sprint\_duration} \\
    Minimize total sprint duration:
    \[
    \min \sum_{sp \in \mathcal{SP}} (\text{end\_date}(sp) - \text{start\_date}(sp)) \quad \text{with weight } 0.9
    \]

    \item \textbf{G8: maximize\_velocity\_trend} \\
    Maximize positive velocity trend:
    \[
    \max \sum_{vel \in \mathcal{VEL}} \text{trend}(vel) \quad \text{with weight } 1.4
    \]

    \item \textbf{G9: maximize\_release\_inclusion} \\
    Maximize features included in releases:
    \[
    \max \sum_{rep \in \mathcal{REP}} |\text{included\_features}(rep)| \quad \text{with weight } 1.0
    \]

    \item \textbf{G10: maximize\_documentation\_linkage} \\
    Maximize linked requirements in documentation:
    \[
    \max \sum_{fed \in \mathcal{FED}} |\text{linked\_requirements}(fed)| \quad \text{with weight } 0.7
    \]

    \item \textbf{G11: minimize\_blocker\_severity} \\
    Minimize total blocker severity:
    \[
    \min \sum_{bl \in \mathcal{BL}} \text{severity}(bl) \quad \text{with weight } 1.3
    \]

    \item \textbf{G12: maximize\_stakeholder\_influence} \\
    Maximize influence of engaged stakeholders:
    \[
    \max \sum_{sh \in \mathcal{SH}} \text{influence\_level}(sh) \quad \text{with weight } 1.0
    \]

    \item \textbf{G13: maximize\_satisfaction\_score} \\
    Maximize team satisfaction:
    \[
    \max \sum_{sp \in \mathcal{SP}} \text{team\_satisfaction}(sp) \quad \text{with weight } 1.2
    \]

    \item \textbf{G14: maximize\_effort\_estimate\_accuracy} \\
    Maximize alignment between estimated and actual effort:
    \[
    \max \sum_{tsk \in \mathcal{TSK}} \left(1 - \frac{|\text{effort}(tsk) - \text{actual\_effort}(tsk)|}{\text{effort}(tsk) + \epsilon}\right) \quad \text{with weight } 0.8
    \]
    where $ \epsilon $ is a small constant to avoid division by zero.
\end{itemize}

\section{4. Conditions}
\begin{itemize}
    \item \textbf{C0: require\_project\_status\_active} \\
    Only include projects with active status:
    \[
    \forall p \in \mathcal{P}: \text{status}(p) = \text{Active}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C1: require\_team\_status\_active} \\
    Only active teams are allowed:
    \[
    \forall t \in \mathcal{T}: \text{team\_status}(t) = \text{Active}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C2: require\_worker\_status\_active} \\
    Only active workers are considered:
    \[
    \forall w \in \mathcal{W}: \text{status}(w) = \text{Active}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C3: require\_feature\_status\_completed} \\
    Only completed features contribute:
    \[
    \forall f \in \mathcal{F}: \text{status}(f) = \text{Completed} \implies \text{included in sum}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C4: require\_user\_story\_status\_done} \\
    Only user stories marked as "Done":
    \[
    \forall us \in \mathcal{US}: \text{status}(us) = \text{Done}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C5: require\_task\_status\_not\_blocked} \\
    Tasks must not be blocked:
    \[
    \forall tsk \in \mathcal{TSK}: \text{status}(tsk) \neq \text{Blocked}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C6: require\_sprint\_status\_completed} \\
    Only completed sprints are valid:
    \[
    \forall sp \in \mathcal{SP}: \text{status}(sp) = \text{Completed}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C7: require\_backlog\_status\_open} \\
    Only open product backlogs:
    \[
    \forall pb \in \mathcal{PB}: \text{status}(pb) = \text{Open}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C8: require\_release\_status\_planned} \\
    Only planned releases:
    \[
    \forall rep \in \mathcal{REP}: \text{status}(rep) = \text{Planned}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C9: require\_roadmap\_within\_timeline} \\
    Roadmap end date must be in the future:
    \[
    \forall rm \in \mathcal{RM}: \text{end\_date}(rm) \geq \text{current\_date}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C10: require\_valid\_skill\_certification} \\
    Only certified skills count:
    \[
    \forall s \in \mathcal{S}: \text{certified}(s) = \text{True}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C11: require\_scum\_board\_updated\_recently} \\
    Scrum board updated within 24 hours:
    \[
    \forall scb \in \mathcal{SCB}: \text{current\_time} - \text{last\_updated}(scb) \leq 24\,\text{h}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C12: require\_positive\_velocity} \\
    Only teams with positive average velocity:
    \[
    \forall vel \in \mathcal{VEL}: \text{avg\_story\_points}(vel) > 0
    \]

    \item \textbf{C13: require\_development\_snapshot\_deployable} \\
    Snapshot must have valid deployment target:
    \[
    \forall dev \in \mathcal{DEV}: \text{deployment\_target}(dev) \in \{\text{Staging}, \text{Production}\}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C14: require\_stakeholder\_relevance\_high} \\
    Only stakeholders with high relevance:
    \[
    \forall sh \in \mathcal{SH}: \text{relevance\_to\_feature}(sh) \geq 4
    \]
\end{itemize}

\section{5. DecisionVariables}
\begin{itemize}
    \item $ dv_0 \in \mathbb{Z}^+ \cup \{0\} $: Number of active projects, $ dv_0 \in \{0,1,2,3,4,5\} $
    \item $ dv_1 \in \mathbb{Z}^+ $: Number of teams, $ dv_1 \in \{1,2,3,4\} $
    \item $ dv_2 \in \mathbb{Z}^+ \cup \{0\} $: Total number of workers, $ 0 \leq dv_2 \leq 50 $
    \item $ dv_3 \in \mathbb{Z}^+ \cup \{0\} $: Number of features, $ 0 \leq dv_3 \leq 100 $
    \item $ dv_4 \in \mathbb{Z}^+ \cup \{0\} $: Number of epics, $ 0 \leq dv_4 \leq 20 $
    \item $ dv_5 \in \mathbb{Z}^+ \cup \{0\} $: Number of user stories, $ 0 \leq dv_5 \leq 200 $
    \item $ dv_6 \in \mathbb{Z}^+ $: Sprint duration in days, $ dv_6 \in \{7,14,21,28\} $
    \item $ dv_7 \in \mathbb{Z}^+ $: Planned sprints per project, $ 1 \leq dv_7 \leq 6 $
    \item $ dv_8 \in \mathbb{R} $: Release version number, $ 1.0 \leq dv_8 \leq 5.0 $
    \item $ dv_9 \in \{1,2,3,4,5\} $: Skill level of a worker
    \item $ dv_{10} \in \{1,2,3,5,8,13\} $: Story point estimate for a user story
    \item $ dv_{11} \in \mathbb{R}^+ $: Blocker resolution time (days), $ 0.0 \leq dv_{11} \leq 30.0 $
    \item $ dv_{12} \in [0.0, 1.0] $: Documentation completion rate (fraction)
    \item $ dv_{13} \in \{1,2,3,4,5\} $: Team satisfaction score
\end{itemize}

\end{document}
```

---

### ✅ Features of This LaTeX Document:
- **Professional structure** with title, author, date, and TOC.
- **Mathematical rigor**: Uses `amsmath`, `amssymb`, and proper indexing.
- **Clear mapping**: Each goal and condition references the original entity and attribute.
- **Logical conditions** are expressed using set notation, indicators, and constraints.
- **Decision variables** are typed and bounded appropriately.
- **Weighted goals** reflect priority in a multi-objective model.

You can compile this with `pdflatex` or any LaTeX processor to generate a clean PDF report suitable for technical stakeholders or model documentation.

Here is a **Mermaid.js** `graph TD` (Top Down) diagram that integrates **all** provided and generated CSV 

- **Entities** (blue)  
- **Attributes** (white, connected to their entities)  
- **Relations** (orange, between entities)  
- **Goals** (green, linked to relevant Entity.Attribute)  
- **Conditions** (red, linked to relevant Entity.Attribute)  
- **Decision Variables** (purple, linked to relevant entities)  

This diagram is designed for use in the [Mermaid Live Editor](https://mermaid.live/edit). Due to complexity, we simplify placement by clustering related elements and allowing attribute duplication for clarity.

---

```csv
R17,participates_in,Stakeholders participate in a Sprint Review,Stakeholder,Sprint Review,N,M,1.0
R18,moderates_retrospective,A Scrum Master moderates the Retrospective,ScrumMaster,SprintRetrospective,1,N,1.0

```
Based on Entities.csv and Relationships.csv - Proceed and Create 3 individual CSV code-blocks (alternative: files) in chat named: Goals.csv + Conditions.csv + DecisionVariables.csv
Goals.csv must have the following header: "ID,Name,Description,IsSum,GoalType,EntityName,EntityAttribute,CriteriaType,Weight"
Conditions.csv must have the following header: "ID,Name,Description,IsSum,GoalType,EntityName,EntityAttribute,CriteriaType,Weight"
DecisionVariables.csv must have the following header: "ID,Name,Description,DataType,Domain,MinValue,MaxValue"

The following conventions must be applied:
ID starts with a letter G(oals), C(onditions), D(ecision)V(ariables) and a number follows, starting at 0, 1, 2, ....
Name is written snake_case
Names for Goals must begin with "maximize_" or "minimize_"
IsSum is a boolean { True, False }
GoalType is one of { "min", "max" }
EntityName is always only 1 entry from the "Name" of Entities.csv
EntityAttribute is one of the values in the "Attribute0" to "Attribute8" of the targeted Entity in Entities.csv
CriteriaType is a number { 2 = Must-Match, 1 = May-Match, 0 = Cannot-Match }
Domain can represent set of values like "{0,1}"
MinValue is the smallest value that can be set
MaxValue is the highest value that can be set
Weight is a mulptlier
Created 10 to 15 entries in each of these files.

Use ALL of the previously provided and generated CSV data (Entities, Relations, Goals, Conditions, DecisionVariables) and formulate the optimization model mathematically and logically. 
Write it into a code-block for a LaTeX (.tex) file and provide the generated Latex code in chat.
The file consists of a introduction page with Title, Author, Date and Table of Contents.
The actual file contest consists of 5 different \sections labeled "1. Sets (Entities)", "2. Indices", "3. Goals", "4. Conditions", "5. DecisionVariables"

content_list.content:
Here is a complete LaTeX `.tex` file that formulates the optimization model based on the provided domain data (Entities, Relationships, Goals, Conditions, Decision Variables). It includes a title page, author, date, table of contents, and five structured sections with itemized content. Mathematical and logical expressions are included for **Goals** and **Conditions**.

```latex
\documentclass[12pt]{article}
\usepackage[utf8]{inputenc}
\usepackage{amsmath, amssymb}
\usepackage{geometry}
\usepackage{titlesec}
\usepackage{hyperref}
\usepackage{enumitem}

\geometry{a4paper, margin=1in}
\titleformat{\section}{\large\bfseries}{}{0em}{}[\titlerule]
\setlength{\parindent}{0pt}
\setlength{\parskip}{0.5em}

\title{\Huge Scrum-Based Software Development Optimization Model \\ \Large Domain-Driven Mathematical Formulation}
\author{\Large Optimization Team \\ Software Development Analytics Group}
\date{\today}

\begin{document}

\maketitle
\tableofcontents
\newpage

\section{1. Sets (Entities)}
\begin{itemize}
    \item $ \mathcal{P} $: Set of Projects $ \{ p \in \text{Project} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{T} $: Set of Teams $ \{ t \in \text{Team} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{W} $: Set of Workers $ \{ w \in \text{Worker} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{F} $: Set of Features $ \{ f \in \text{Feature} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{S} $: Set of Skills $ \{ s \in \text{Skill} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{R} $: Set of Roles $ \{ r \in \text{Role} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{PO} $: Set of Product Owners $ \{ po \in \text{ProductOwner} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SM} $: Set of Scrum Masters $ \{ sm \in \text{ScrumMaster} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{PB} $: Set of Product Backlogs $ \{ pb \in \text{ProductBacklog} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SP} $: Set of Sprints $ \{ sp \in \text{Sprint} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SBL} $: Set of Sprint Backlogs $ \{ sbl \in \text{SprintBacklog} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{US} $: Set of User Stories $ \{ us \in \text{UserStory} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{TSK} $: Set of Tasks $ \{ tsk \in \text{Task} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{E} $: Set of Epics $ \{ e \in \text{Epic} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{DEV} $: Set of Development Snapshots $ \{ dev \in \text{DevelopmentSnapshot} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{BL} $: Set of Blockers $ \{ bl \in \text{Blocker} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SH} $: Set of Stakeholders $ \{ sh \in \text{Stakeholder} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{VEL} $: Set of Velocity Records $ \{ vel \in \text{Velocity} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{REP} $: Set of Release Plans $ \{ rep \in \text{ReleasePlan} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{RM} $: Set of Roadmaps $ \{ rm \in \text{Roadmap} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SCB} $: Set of Scrum Boards $ \{ scb \in \text{ScrumBoard} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{FED} $: Set of Feature Documentations $ \{ fed \in \text{FeatureDocumentation} \} $
\end{itemize}

\section{2. Indices}
\begin{itemize}
    \item $ p \in \mathcal{P} $: Index for a project
    \item $ t \in \mathcal{T} $: Index for a team
    \item $ w \in \mathcal{W} $: Index for a worker
    \item $ f \in \mathcal{F} $: Index for a feature
    \item $ s \in \mathcal{S} $: Index for a skill
    \item $ r \in \mathcal{R} $: Index for a role
    \item $ sp \in \mathcal{SP} $: Index for a sprint
    \item $ us \in \mathcal{US} $: Index for a user story
    \item $ tsk \in \mathcal{TSK} $: Index for a task
    \item $ e \in \mathcal{E} $: Index for an epic
    \item $ bl \in \mathcal{BL} $: Index for a blocker
    \item $ sh \in \mathcal{SH} $: Index for a stakeholder
    \item $ rep \in \mathcal{REP} $: Index for a release plan
    \item $ rm \in \mathcal{RM} $: Index for a roadmap
    \item $ vel \in \mathcal{VEL} $: Index for a velocity record
\end{itemize}

\section{3. Goals}
\begin{itemize}
    \item \textbf{G0: maximize\_project\_budget} \\
    Maximize total budget across active projects: 
    \[
    \max \sum_{p \in \mathcal{P}} \text{budget}(p) \quad \text{with weight } 1.5
    \]

    \item \textbf{G1: maximize\_project\_priority} \\
    Maximize sum of project priorities:
    \[
    \max \sum_{p \in \mathcal{P}} \text{priority}(p) \quad \text{with weight } 1.0
    \]

    \item \textbf{G2: maximize\_team\_size} \\
    Maximize total team capacity:
    \[
    \max \sum_{t \in \mathcal{T}} \text{team\_size}(t) \quad \text{with weight } 1.2
    \]

    \item \textbf{G3: minimize\_worker\_availability} \\
    Minimize unavailability (i.e., maximize availability):
    \[
    \min \sum_{w \in \mathcal{W}} (1 - \text{availability}(w)) \quad \text{with weight } 0.8
    \]

    \item \textbf{G4: maximize\_feature\_priority} \\
    Maximize total feature priority:
    \[
    \max \sum_{f \in \mathcal{F}} \text{priority}(f) \quad \text{with weight } 1.3
    \]

    \item \textbf{G5: maximize\_story\_points} \\
    Maximize completed story points:
    \[
    \max \sum_{us \in \mathcal{US}} \text{story\_points}(us) \cdot \mathbb{I}[\text{status}(us) = \text{Done}] \quad \text{with weight } 1.1
    \]

    \item \textbf{G6: maximize\_sprint\_achievement} \\
    Maximize sprint goal achievement:
    \[
    \max \sum_{sp \in \mathcal{SP}} \text{achievement\_of\_goal}(sp) \quad \text{with weight } 1.6
    \]

    \item \textbf{G7: minimize\_sprint\_duration} \\
    Minimize total sprint duration:
    \[
    \min \sum_{sp \in \mathcal{SP}} (\text{end\_date}(sp) - \text{start\_date}(sp)) \quad \text{with weight } 0.9
    \]

    \item \textbf{G8: maximize\_velocity\_trend} \\
    Maximize positive velocity trend:
    \[
    \max \sum_{vel \in \mathcal{VEL}} \text{trend}(vel) \quad \text{with weight } 1.4
    \]

    \item \textbf{G9: maximize\_release\_inclusion} \\
    Maximize features included in releases:
    \[
    \max \sum_{rep \in \mathcal{REP}} |\text{included\_features}(rep)| \quad \text{with weight } 1.0
    \]

    \item \textbf{G10: maximize\_documentation\_linkage} \\
    Maximize linked requirements in documentation:
    \[
    \max \sum_{fed \in \mathcal{FED}} |\text{linked\_requirements}(fed)| \quad \text{with weight } 0.7
    \]

    \item \textbf{G11: minimize\_blocker\_severity} \\
    Minimize total blocker severity:
    \[
    \min \sum_{bl \in \mathcal{BL}} \text{severity}(bl) \quad \text{with weight } 1.3
    \]

    \item \textbf{G12: maximize\_stakeholder\_influence} \\
    Maximize influence of engaged stakeholders:
    \[
    \max \sum_{sh \in \mathcal{SH}} \text{influence\_level}(sh) \quad \text{with weight } 1.0
    \]

    \item \textbf{G13: maximize\_satisfaction\_score} \\
    Maximize team satisfaction:
    \[
    \max \sum_{sp \in \mathcal{SP}} \text{team\_satisfaction}(sp) \quad \text{with weight } 1.2
    \]

    \item \textbf{G14: maximize\_effort\_estimate\_accuracy} \\
    Maximize alignment between estimated and actual effort:
    \[
    \max \sum_{tsk \in \mathcal{TSK}} \left(1 - \frac{|\text{effort}(tsk) - \text{actual\_effort}(tsk)|}{\text{effort}(tsk) + \epsilon}\right) \quad \text{with weight } 0.8
    \]
    where $ \epsilon $ is a small constant to avoid division by zero.
\end{itemize}

\section{4. Conditions}
\begin{itemize}
    \item \textbf{C0: require\_project\_status\_active} \\
    Only include projects with active status:
    \[
    \forall p \in \mathcal{P}: \text{status}(p) = \text{Active}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C1: require\_team\_status\_active} \\
    Only active teams are allowed:
    \[
    \forall t \in \mathcal{T}: \text{team\_status}(t) = \text{Active}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C2: require\_worker\_status\_active} \\
    Only active workers are considered:
    \[
    \forall w \in \mathcal{W}: \text{status}(w) = \text{Active}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C3: require\_feature\_status\_completed} \\
    Only completed features contribute:
    \[
    \forall f \in \mathcal{F}: \text{status}(f) = \text{Completed} \implies \text{included in sum}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C4: require\_user\_story\_status\_done} \\
    Only user stories marked as "Done":
    \[
    \forall us \in \mathcal{US}: \text{status}(us) = \text{Done}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C5: require\_task\_status\_not\_blocked} \\
    Tasks must not be blocked:
    \[
    \forall tsk \in \mathcal{TSK}: \text{status}(tsk) \neq \text{Blocked}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C6: require\_sprint\_status\_completed} \\
    Only completed sprints are valid:
    \[
    \forall sp \in \mathcal{SP}: \text{status}(sp) = \text{Completed}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C7: require\_backlog\_status\_open} \\
    Only open product backlogs:
    \[
    \forall pb \in \mathcal{PB}: \text{status}(pb) = \text{Open}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C8: require\_release\_status\_planned} \\
    Only planned releases:
    \[
    \forall rep \in \mathcal{REP}: \text{status}(rep) = \text{Planned}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C9: require\_roadmap\_within\_timeline} \\
    Roadmap end date must be in the future:
    \[
    \forall rm \in \mathcal{RM}: \text{end\_date}(rm) \geq \text{current\_date}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C10: require\_valid\_skill\_certification} \\
    Only certified skills count:
    \[
    \forall s \in \mathcal{S}: \text{certified}(s) = \text{True}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C11: require\_scum\_board\_updated\_recently} \\
    Scrum board updated within 24 hours:
    \[
    \forall scb \in \mathcal{SCB}: \text{current\_time} - \text{last\_updated}(scb) \leq 24\,\text{h}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C12: require\_positive\_velocity} \\
    Only teams with positive average velocity:
    \[
    \forall vel \in \mathcal{VEL}: \text{avg\_story\_points}(vel) > 0
    \]

    \item \textbf{C13: require\_development\_snapshot\_deployable} \\
    Snapshot must have valid deployment target:
    \[
    \forall dev \in \mathcal{DEV}: \text{deployment\_target}(dev) \in \{\text{Staging}, \text{Production}\}
    \]

    \item \textbf{C14: require\_stakeholder\_relevance\_high} \\
    Only stakeholders with high relevance:
    \[
    \forall sh \in \mathcal{SH}: \text{relevance\_to\_feature}(sh) \geq 4
    \]
\end{itemize}

\section{5. DecisionVariables}
\begin{itemize}
    \item $ dv_0 \in \mathbb{Z}^+ \cup \{0\} $: Number of active projects, $ dv_0 \in \{0,1,2,3,4,5\} $
    \item $ dv_1 \in \mathbb{Z}^+ $: Number of teams, $ dv_1 \in \{1,2,3,4\} $
    \item $ dv_2 \in \mathbb{Z}^+ \cup \{0\} $: Total number of workers, $ 0 \leq dv_2 \leq 50 $
    \item $ dv_3 \in \mathbb{Z}^+ \cup \{0\} $: Number of features, $ 0 \leq dv_3 \leq 100 $
    \item $ dv_4 \in \mathbb{Z}^+ \cup \{0\} $: Number of epics, $ 0 \leq dv_4 \leq 20 $
    \item $ dv_5 \in \mathbb{Z}^+ \cup \{0\} $: Number of user stories, $ 0 \leq dv_5 \leq 200 $
    \item $ dv_6 \in \mathbb{Z}^+ $: Sprint duration in days, $ dv_6 \in \{7,14,21,28\} $
    \item $ dv_7 \in \mathbb{Z}^+ $: Planned sprints per project, $ 1 \leq dv_7 \leq 6 $
    \item $ dv_8 \in \mathbb{R} $: Release version number, $ 1.0 \leq dv_8 \leq 5.0 $
    \item $ dv_9 \in \{1,2,3,4,5\} $: Skill level of a worker
    \item $ dv_{10} \in \{1,2,3,5,8,13\} $: Story point estimate for a user story
    \item $ dv_{11} \in \mathbb{R}^+ $: Blocker resolution time (days), $ 0.0 \leq dv_{11} \leq 30.0 $
    \item $ dv_{12} \in [0.0, 1.0] $: Documentation completion rate (fraction)
    \item $ dv_{13} \in \{1,2,3,4,5\} $: Team satisfaction score
\end{itemize}

\end{document}
```

---

### ✅ Features of This LaTeX Document:
- **Professional structure** with title, author, date, and TOC.
- **Mathematical rigor**: Uses `amsmath`, `amssymb`, and proper indexing.
- **Clear mapping**: Each goal and condition references the original entity and attribute.
- **Logical conditions** are expressed using set notation, indicators, and constraints.
- **Decision variables** are typed and bounded appropriately.
- **Weighted goals** reflect priority in a multi-objective model.

You can compile this with `pdflatex` or any LaTeX processor to generate a clean PDF report suitable for technical stakeholders or model documentation.
